column5: June 10 PPL Corp and Riverstone Holdings LLC on Monday said they would combine their merchant power generation businesses into a new stand-alone  publicly traded independent power producer.

column4: Osum Oil Sands Corp to buy Shell's Orion project for C$325 mln
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  June 10 Osum Oil Sands Corp  a private energy company chaired by former Suncor Energy Inc  Chief Executive Rick George  agreed on Tuesday to buy Shell Canada's Orion oil sands project for C$325 million ($298.11 million).

column4: Taiwan stocks hit over 6-yr closing high
column5: TAIPEI  June 10 Taiwan stocks rose 0.7 percent to close at their highest level in more than six years on Tuesday  outperforming most regional bourses  as investors shrugged off disappointing May export data..         The main TAIEX index ended at 9 222.37 points  a level not seen since May 2008.       Among the top winners  both electronics and banks  climbed 0.7 percent or more. They were the market's two most heavily-weighted sectors.      The Taiwan dollar was up 0.16 percent at T

column5: U.S. retailer Target Corp  named General Motors Co  executive Brad Maiorino to the newly created position of chief information security officer  as part of its plan to tighten its security following a massive data breach last year.

column4: TransCanada to file Energy East project application in mid-August
column5: MONTREAL  June 10 TransCanada Corp  Canada's No. 2 pipeline operator  expects to file an application for its C$12 billion ($11.01 billion) Energy East pipeline with energy regulators in mid-August  the company's chief executive told Reuters on Tuesday.

column4: Cukurova nears Turkcell financing deal with Turkish partner: sources
column5: ISTANBUL Turkey's Cukurova Holding is close to securing financing from a local partner to recover a disputed stake in the country's biggest mobile phone operator Turkcell  three sources close to the matter said on Tuesday.

column4: PRECIOUS-Platinum extends gains to 5th day; palladium near 3-year top
column5: SINGAPORE  June 10 Platinum extended its winning streak to a fifth straight session on Tuesday as talks to resolve a 5-month long strike in top producer South Africa were deadlocked  with the mining minister quitting his role as a mediator.      Palladium  of which South Africa is the second biggest producer  was near its highest in nearly three years  while trading in gold was muted as global equities were near a record high.
